title: Henry Winkler playfully dodges question about feud with Tom Hanks: 'What did you say?'
text:
CLOSE

Tom Hanks and Henry Winkler (Photo: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images and Charles Sykes/Bravo)

It seems Henry Winkler's short time on the "Turner & Hooch" set was not all "Happy Days."

The 73-year-old actor subtly threw some shade the way of the 1989 feature's star Tom Hanks on Bravo's "Watch What Happens Live With Andy Cohen" when taking a question from a caller Thursday.

"What was the real reason why you and Tom Hanks didn't get along on the set of 'Turner & Hooch,' and did you ever wind up seeing that movie?" the fan asked.

"Is that a thing?!" a surprised Cohen inquired.

"What did you say?" Winkler responded, playfully putting his hand to his ear.

Henry Winkler: From Fonzie at age 27 to 'Barry' at 72 (and finally, an Emmy)

Henry Winkler inks 3-book deal for new 'Alien Superstar' series

"I was directing that movie for 13 days, and then I was called into (chairman of Walt Disney Studios at the time) Jeff Katzenberg's office. And he said, 'Do you have everything with you? Go home.' "

"No!" Cohen said, shocked.

Rather than mention Hanks, Winkler made a point of gushing over Hanks' canine co-star.

"I got along great, great with that dog," he said. "Love that dog."

That wasn't Winkler's only dig. When Cohen asked if he viewed the flick, Winkler responded, "I don't remember the title of that movie."

Exclusive cover reveal: First look at Mister Rogers picture book bio, 'Hello, Neighbor!'

description: It seems Henry Winkler's short time on the 1989 feature "Turner & Hooch," which starred Tom Hanks, was not all "Happy Days."
